intro: [WRONG START] Brassica richeri, commonly known as the Cook Islands cabbage tree, is a flowering plant native to the Cook Islands and nearby Pacific islands. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible plants such as broccoli and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, palmately lobed leaves that are often used in traditional Polynesian cuisine. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces distinctive, elongated pods containing seeds. Brassicella richeri is adapted to coastal and sandy environments, making it an important part of the local flora and ecosystem.
